author: bbcnickrobinson

text: The interview was trying to address a crucial question - no deal versus  no change to the backstop. The guest wanted - for reasons i understand - to deny the choice set out here - https://www.irishtimes.com/opinion/cliff-taylor-ireland-could-face-choice-of-backstop-concessions-or-no-deal-brexit-1.3770820 …

text: Touché or is that touchy?!
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: A patient wrote to a German Jewish Dr in 1933 to say he could no long be seen coming in the front door. I have that letter sent to my grandfather. It’s message - I trust you, a Jew, to save my life but I’ll take no risk to save yours. That’s why we remember the Holocaust
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: I wrote about my grandparents on National Holocaust Day & somehow you turned it into a cheap partisan point
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: My German Jewish grandparents were amongst the lucky survivors of the Holocaust. They fled  Berlin in 1933.  I’ll never forget. I hope you won’t. It is our greatest defence against it happening again - not just to Jews but to any race or minority
author: bbcnickrobinson

text:
What PM could say (in order of likelihood)
A. I fight on. My deal is in national interest 
B. Parliament must decide but I’ll give MPs a free vote (& hope that saves my deal)
C. Michael Gove, my new Brexit Sec, will re-negotiate my deal as it can’t command a majority 
D. I quit

text: Speed & ferocity of onslaught on PM’s Brexit deal by Boris, Rees Mogg, IDS & the DUP shows both their strength & their weakness. They need to kill it before it’s been read by anyone let alone signed by 27 other EU leaders allowing No 10 to frame choice as this deal v no deal.
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: So, we’re off. Cabinet to be invited to approve draft EU withdrawal agreement - one to one meetings  tonight & full Cabinet tomorrow. If the Leavers who’ve been threatening to quit are going to do it it’s now or never.

text: How will the big spending increase on the NHS be paid for? We won't get the answers until ministers have discussed options with Tory MPs & the NHS has produced a 10 year plan @Jeremy_Hunt tells @BBCr4today
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: Sure - growth appears in the economic forecasts but my pint was that politicians like to predict above trend growth if their policy wheezes are implemented - eg “borrowing to invest”, deregulation or Brexit - but the economists are reluctant to rely on them.
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: But given that there is no way of knowing whether the economy will grow more the Treasury never relies on that to fund future spending commitments.
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: This NHS announcement is by far the biggest call @theresa_may has made as Prime Minister (other than promising that “Brexit will mean Brexit”). A Tory leader is promising more public spending paid for by more tax and more borrowing.
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: Governments can only pay for increasing spending by raising taxes, increasing borrowing or cutting other spending. “Dividends” are what politicians talk about when they don’t want to spell out  which of those they are going to do
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: That’s less than the average increase over the NHS’s lifetime but will still require tax & borrowing increases to pay for it
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: The NHS is being promised a lot more money over the next 5 years. A big move by Theresa May but bear in mind that the planned 3.4% annual increase is roughly what it got in the Thatcher years
author: bbcnickrobinson

text: A kind offer. I’ll ask my producer !

text: So, you say we should have zero tolerance of anti Semitism & we should be worried about its resurgence. Yet when I tweet about it you say “what about...?” and call me a hypocrite. Odd

text: Remembering the Holocaust does not mean criticising Labour or Corbyn or backing their critics.  Nor does it mean supporting the Israeli govt or ignoring the Palestinians. It is simply the way we all face up to the worst that man can do to man & pledge “Never Again”
